resources:
CardioGo


1. Get a big step backward with one leg.

 2. Lower your hips.

 3. Slowly push your body back to starting position.




1.Begin with your legs hip-width separated.

 2. While exhaling, swing your arms and jump to contrary.

 3. Shift your weight to your opposite leg behind you.




1. Stand with feet a little wider than hip width.

 2. Get down on all fours.

 3. Step your legs forward to return to stand up.




1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart.

 2. Lift up one knee to your chest.

 3. Continue for alternating legs.




1. Begin in the full plank position.

 2. lift one arm up into a horizontal position to make a good salute.

 3. Rest your arm on the ground.




1. Raise one foot on the bench.

 2. Lift your body by pivoting the raised foot.

 3. Step down from the bench.




1. Stand with feet a little wider than hip width.

 2. Lean on a knee level platform.

 3. Step your legs forward to return to stand up.




1. Begin in a standing position.

 2. With one hand, tap your foot with a crisscross motion.

 3. Continue with alternating motion.




1. Lift your right arm and left foot at the same time.

 2. Then switch to the opposite foot, quickly lifting your right.

 3. At the same time, move your right arm back and your left arm.




1. Lift your right arm and left foot at the same time.

 2. Then switch to the opposite foot, quickly lifting your right.

 3. At the same time, move your right arm back and your left arm.




1. Stand just in front of your chair, facing away from it.

 2. Engage your core as you bend your knees and lower your hips.

 3. Gently tap the chair with your butt, then slowly get back to starting position.




1. Stand with your feet slightly apart and your arms at your side.

 2. March in place.

 3. Repeat the process.




1. Start in a standing position with your feet together and your arms at your sides.

 2. Step your feet outwards to the side while you lift your arms until your hands meet over your head.

 3. Step your feet inwards and lower your arms to your sides.




1. Stand infront of a wall with your arms straight out in front of you. Your palms should be on the wall.

 2. Bend your elbows and begin to lean your body toward the wall until your nose almost touches it.

 3. Push back to the starting position and repeat.




1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.

 2. Put your arms on the chair and take a step backward and then forward.

 3. Then go back to standing position and raise your arms.
